description:
![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F9827603%2F3e77ae7781e13e959dd094bad86a607a%2Fcbly%20header.png?generation=1678274509337901&alt=media) ## The Chernobyl Disaster Air Concentration Dataset ***Nuclear, Chernobyl, Disaster, Air Concentration*** By: [[source](https://www.openml.org/)]
## Description The Chernobyl disaster was a nuclear accident that occurred on 26 April 1986 at the No. 4 nuclear reactor in the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant, near the city of Pripyat in the north of the Ukrainian SSR. It is considered the worst nuclear disaster in history and is one of only two nuclear energy disasters rated at seven - the maximum severity - on the International Nuclear Event Scale, the other being the 2011 Fukushima Daiichi nuclear disaster in Japan. Content This dataset presents concentration of Iodine-131 (I-131) and Caesium-134 (Cs-134) as anaerosol particles which were measured in specific location and date.
## Field Names and Descriptions | Field Name | Description | | --- | --- | | PAYS | country abbreviation | | Code| country code | | Ville | locality name | | X | lattitude (degrees.hundredths of degrees) | | Y | longitude (degrees.hundredths of degrees) | | Date | date (year/month/day) | | End_of_sampling | hour of end of sampling (hours:minutes) | | Duration(h.min) | duration (hours.minutes) | | I_131_(Bq/m3) | I-131 concentration in Bq/m3 (aerosol particles) | | Cs_134_(Bq/m3) | Cs-134 concentration in Bq/m3 (aerosol particles) | | Cs_137_(Bq/m3) | Cs-137 concentration in Bq/m3 (aerosol particles) |
## Acknowledgements 1. Data extracted from REM data bank at CEC Joint Research Centre Ispra. 2. Data was downloaded from JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE Directorate for Nuclear Safety and Security.
## Inspiration In which area the air was mostly polluted?
title: The Chernobyl Disaster Air Concentration
